definition: to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: Think you know your work setting well enough to tread on this dangerous ground?
sentences.chinese: 你以为你的幽默感好得可以无所忌惮？

sentences.english: Or will a region that fears innovation inevitably fall behind?
sentences.chinese: 还是说，这个忌惮创新的地区终将落后于人呢？

sentences.english: Mr. White have uncontrollable greed for fame and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生毫无忌惮地贪求名利。

sentences.english: Unbridled drink it and enjoy, enjoy the ease of food.
sentences.chinese: 肆无忌惮的开怀畅饮，轻松自如的享受美食。

sentences.english: He had the courage to express his opinion.
sentences.chinese: 他毫无忌惮地发表了他的意见。

sentences.english: The invaders brazened their way into our motherland.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者肆无忌惮地闯入了我们祖国。

sentences.english: The Chinese government is terrified of inflation, which it fears might spark unrest.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府极为忌惮通货膨胀，担心这将引发社会动荡。

sentences.english: Troops indiscriminately massacred the defenceless population.
sentences.chinese: 军队肆无忌惮地屠杀手无寸铁的民众。

sentences.english: The pirates roamed with impunity, often ransacking and even decimating coastal settlements.
sentences.chinese: 这些盗贼肆无忌惮，经常掠夺甚至残杀沿海的居民。

sentences.english: She shouted abuse without any restraint.
They looked at me uncompromisingly as if I was a nice meaty dish.
sentences.chinese: 他们肆无忌惮地瞄着我，好像我是一只光鸡。

sentences.english: With the protection of law enforcement officials, counterfeiters will be more reckless.
sentences.chinese: 由于执法方面的包庇，造假者更加肆无忌惮。

sentences.english: His intemperate (ie thoughtlessly angry or rude) remarks got him into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他言语肆无忌惮，惹出了是非。

sentences.english: I will laugh unbridled, rampant cry.
sentences.chinese: 我要肆无忌惮的笑，肆意妄为的哭。

sentences.english: At the end of the war, the land grab by the Chiang government was even more callous and more open.
sentences.chinese: 抗战结束后，蒋介石政府对土地的侵夺更加肆无忌惮。

sentences.english: Do subordinates, superiors in the face of unbridled drinking.
sentences.chinese: 做下属的，最忌在上司面前肆无忌惮。

definition: hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
